title: Ranked and lag don't go well together
body:
During my time playing ranked I have notice a reoccurring problem with some of the players I play with and that would be lag. People with bad ping (300+ ms) are basically not in the game it's always "a summoner has disconnected" "a summoner has reconnected"  but for some unknown reason they continue to walk to and dc die reconnect, rage at the enemy for "bm" then dc again and it is so frustrating playing with.

What I'm suggest (just for ranked) placing in a system that determines if your Ping is good enough to go through the whole game without disconnecting and reconnecting.

Just an idea let me know what you guys think

replies.body:
Seems like a good idea but we don't want to exclude players with high ping. 

300 - 500 ping is actually playable to some extent, and shouldn't cause _"a summoner has disconnected"_. I believe heavy packet loss and other symptoms of a bad connection will cause that, but not just ping. On **NA** I play with 260 ping and it's very workable, I don't see why 300 ping and a bit over might be unplayable.

It's really the summoners responsibility to assess whether they are able to play the game properly with their equipment.
Maybe instead it could just be an indicator telling you, but you make the decision of going into ranked or not. That should work, right?
I think that would work as well
people already go into game knowing their ping is bad, this won't make any difference.

Yeah it will. For me, there's a very rare occasion that I lag for a whole game, and I don't know when it happens. Maybe once I've lagged in a ranked, several times have had lag spikes. Knowing before the game starts would be really helpful. It will also make people think if it's even worth doing ranked.
